title: Tintern Old Station - Wye Valley Park Walk Route

images.title: Roy Parkhouse / Field by Tintern Old Station
images.caption: Field by Tintern Old Station. The view is from the river bank footpath, looking towards Brockweir with the river Wye on the right and the dismantled railway on the left. Tintern Old Station can just be glimpsed, left of centre, in the trees.

images.title: Roy Parkhouse / The Old Station, Tintern
images.caption: The Old Station, Tintern

images.title: Roy Parkhouse / Tintern and Barbadoes Hill
images.caption: Tintern and Barbadoes Hill From the riverbank footpath to The Old Station

images.title: Roy Parkhouse / Steps on the footpath to Tintern Old Station
images.caption: Steps on the footpath to Tintern Old Station This footpath from Brockweir to Tintern Old Station (the direction to which is behind the camera) follows the bed of the old railway track. The railway tunnel under Brockweir road bridge is to the right of these steps and hidden by bramble growth.

description: This park is situated in the Wye Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (AONB) near Chepstow. It was voted the UK's favourite park in the 2011 People's Choice Green Flag Award public poll.  The station was originally opened in 1876 and closed in 1959. It now serves as a popular tourist attraction with three old carriages used as a gift shop and museum with old railway memorabilia. There is a one mile circular walk around the park with a section along the River Wye. You could follow the river further along the Wye Valley Walk if you wanted to continue your walk.
